node.statement: INTERLACING OF GAMMA_K WITH LAMBDA_I: By Rolle's theorem applied to the polynomial r (which has degree n with n simple real roots lambda_1 < ... < lambda_n), the derivative r' has exactly n-1 real roots, one in each interval (lambda_i, lambda_{i+1}) for i = 1, ..., n-1. Since r'(x) = n * s(x) = n * prod_{k=1}^{n-1}(x - gamma_k), the roots of r' are exactly gamma_1, ..., gamma_{n-1}. Therefore lambda_1 < gamma_1 < lambda_2 < gamma_2 < ... < gamma_{n-1} < lambda_n. This strict interlacing ensures that lambda_i - gamma_k != 0 for all i, k, making all terms 1/(lambda_i - gamma_k) well-defined.
